alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 01 at 11:02PM CST until March 03 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY LATE THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... .A strong cold front will bring lower humidity and gusty northwesterly winds Thursday night into early Friday morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires Thursday night. Conditions improve Friday morning as winds diminish. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THURSDAY TO 6 AM CST FRIDAY FOR THE MIDDLE AND LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES... * AFFECTED AREA...Inland Kenedy, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron and Northern Hidalgo. * TIMING... 11 PM THURSDAY TO 6 AM FRIDAY. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 14 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo
